description: Once a Victorian arboretum, Abney Park Cemetery, part of London's Magnificent Seven, was revitalised with National Heritage Lottery funding in 2021. The renovation restored the chapel and main entrance, creating a vibrant workshop space for London-based art and design collective, WAX Atelier. During Open House, WAX Atelier will showcase innovative projects in their unique workspace amidst the park

factsheet.heading: The Abney Effect
paragraphs: Our parks define a meeting point within local communities, uniting individuals through a shared desire to experience what is perceived by many as ‘natural’.

Experience 'The Abney Effect' at WAX Atelier Labs—an installation inspired by Sir William de Wiveleslie Abney's light theory, exploring how white light alters colour perception. Abney Park, acting as the “white light”, offers fresh perspectives on works by 10 designers, emphasising collaboration and innovation.

Situated in WAX Atelier’s open studio within the newly renovated Abney Park, one of London's 'Magnificent Seven' garden cemeteries, the installation invites exploration into design and material innovation. Featuring a diverse array of tools, material samples, and objects by established and emerging designers, the showcase highlights tree-derived materials such as oils, waxes, resins, and dyes, demonstrating their transformation into innovative design and craft objects.

'The Abney Effect' unfolds as a metaphorical journey illustrating how nature, process, and creativity intersect in unexpected ways. It provides an immersive experience that celebrates the dynamic interplay between these materials and their potential outcomes, offering visitors a deeper understanding of their significance in contemporary design and craft.
